p: The fresh leaves of Ziziphora clinopodioides were gathered at the full flowering stage in May–July 2018 from natural growing plants located in Kermanshah Province Mountains, Iran. Then, ground air‐dried leaves (100 g) of Z. clinopodioides and distilled water (2000 ml) were subjected to a Clevenger apparatus system and steam distillated for 3 hr. Next, the collected essential oil was kept in an opaque glass tube under refrigerated condition until further use. The components of the used essential oil were identified by gas chromatography–mass spectrometer in our previous study (Hasan et al., 2019).
